meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a sharp blow
meanings.sent1: He used a stick to thwack the ball across the field.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter would thwack the nail into the wood with his hammer.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to thwack the dough to make it flat for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to thwack the trees with its powerful winds.
meanings.sent5: The teacher demonstrated how to thwack the drum to produce a loud sound.

meanings.sent1: The thwack of the bat hitting the ball echoed through the stadium.
meanings.sent2: She winced at the thwack of the door slamming shut behind her.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected thwack of the snowball hitting him made him laugh.
meanings.sent4: The thwack of the gavel signaled the end of the court session.
meanings.sent5: The thwack of the whip made the audience gasp in the circus show.
